description:
'''Country metal''' is the fusion country music elements with [[Heavy metal music|heavy metal]].

In 2002, [[Kid Rock]] was quoted in ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' describing himself as a "country-metal-[[rapping|rap]] hillbilly". In 2006, [[David Allan Coe]] featuring [[Dimebag Darrell]], [[Vinnie Paul]], and [[Rex Brown]], all from [[Pantera]], released the collaborative album ''[[Rebel Meets Rebel]]'', which [[Allmusic]] described as a "groundbreaking" mix of country and heavy metal, and noted that [[fiddle]] is included, being played by Joey Floyd. [[Billboard (magazine)|''Billboard'']] also noted that [[Jason Aldean]]'s thunderous 2008 single "[[She's Country]]" received comparisons to [[AC/DC]]. [[Brantley Gilbert]] and [[Hardy (singer)|Hardy]] have been described as country metal, with Hardy incorporating nu metal elements into his sound. 

'''Countrycore''' is a genre term created by the media to describe the style of Brazilian band [[Matanza (band)|Matanza]], who fuse country music with heavy metal and hardcore punk.
